item.title: Useful Azure AD Powershell snippets
item.description: I’ve been doing a lot of Azure AD stuff lately, so here are some powershell snippets that have been coming in handy. I always forget toÂ Connect-AzureAD first, so don’t do that Get extension properties of a user (e.g. created date) Get-AzureADUser -SearchString ‘username or email addy’ | select -ExpandProperty ExtensionProperty Get guest users that are not members of a specified group $allGuests = Get-AzureADUser -Filter “usertype eq ‘guest’” -All $true

item.title: Azure AD error - 'IDX10311: RequireNonce is true but validationContext.Nonce is null'
item.description: I’ve experienced this one enough times now that I’d like to preserve the solution/s for future occurrences. The exact message is: IDX10311: RequireNonce is ‘true’ (default) but validationContext.Nonce is null. A nonce cannot be validated. If you don’t need to check the nonce, set OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator.RequireNonce to ‘false’.An easy way to reproduce this one is to hit the “back” button after having signed in to an ASP.NET web app that auths with Azure AD using the OWIN library.

item.title: Azure Active Directory Redirect Loop
item.description: While developing an Azure web app that uses Azure AD integration, I ran into a mysterious redirect loop, first on my wife’s phone while trying to show it off (embarrassing!) and then again at work. Turns out that if you don’t specify https, the Microsoft sign-in page keeps redirecting back to the app and vice-versa. Took me a little while to figure this out, thanks to tugberkugurlu for finding the solution!
